note.para: The standard position and the forward position top covers use different housing. The forward housing also uses a plate and a gasket installed over the detent balls and springs.

step1.para: Lubricate all the parts of the top cover with the oil that is used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Clean the threads of the fasteners with Loctite Safety Solvent #755 or equivalent. Make sure all dirt is removed from the threads.

note.para: Refer to the specifications of the sealant manufacturer for "cure" time.

step1.para: Apply Loctite #242 or equivalent to the threads of the fasteners.
Install the top cover in a vise with brass jaws. Make sure the low-reverse bore holes are toward the bottom of the vise.
Install the short pin in the bore for the neutral safety switch. Install the switch or plug and tighten to 47 to 68 Nm (35 to 50 ft-lbs.) ( Figure 260).
Install the breather vent in the top cover. Tighten to 20 to 27 Nm (15 to 20 ft-lbs) (Figure 260).

note.para: On standard position top covers, one or two reverse switches may be used. On forward position top covers, one reverse switch is used.

step1.para: Install the larger pin(s) in the bore(s) for the reverse switch. Install the switches or plugs and tighten to 47 to 68 Nm (35 to 50 ft-lbs.) ( Figure 260).

figure.caption: Figure 260. Install Larger Pins in Bores

step1.para: Put the low-reverse shift fork in a vise with brass jaws.
Install the spring and the ball in the bore next to the plunger.
Install the plunger and the spring in the bore of the fork (Figure 261).
Install the snap ring that holds the assembly in the fork (Figure 261).

note.para: The low-reverse shaft is the shortest of the three shafts.

step1.para: Put the low-reverse shift shaft in the bottom bore of the housing. Make sure the boss on the end of the shaft is toward the rear of the housing. Make sure the detent grooves in the rail are aligned with the detent ball holes in the housing (Figure 262).

Put the low-reverse shift fork assembly in the top cover so that the plunger of the fork is toward you. Make sure the bore of the fork and sleeve assembly is aligned with the bore in the housing (Figure 262).

figure.caption: Figure 262. Put Low-Reverse Shift Shaft in Bottom Bore

step1.para: Push the shift shaft through the low-reverse sleeve and fork assembly until the holes in the fork and shaft are aligned.

caution.para: After the set screws with the Loctite sealant are tightened to the specified torque, do not loosen or tighten. If loosened or tightened, the set screws must be removed, cleaned and new sealant applied or the set screws may loosen during operation.

step1.para: Install the set screw with the Loctite sealant that fastens the fork in position on the shaft. Tighten the set screw to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.) (Figure 263).
Install the lock wire in the holes in the bolt and the fork and sleeve assembly (Figure 263).

Install the neutral check shaft in the bore on the top of the housing. Make sure the round end of the shaft is installed toward the low-reverse shift shaft. Make sure the end of the neutral check shaft touches the slot in the Low/Reverse shaft (Figure 264).
Put the large interlock ball in the bottom of the middle bore of the first set of bores on the rear of the housing ( Figure 265).

figure.caption: Figure 265. Put Large Interlock Ball in Bottom of Middle Bore

note.para: The 1-2 shift rail is the same size as the 3-4 shift rail and has a hole drilled through the rail.
Move the low-reverse shift shaft assembly so that the interlock ball is completely installed in the bore. Move the low-reverse shaft assembly so that the 1-2 rail can be installed.

step1.para: Put the 1-2 shift shaft in the middle bore of the housing. Make sure the identification on the end of the shaft is toward the front of the housing. Make sure the detent grooves in the shaft are aligned with the detent ball holes in the housing (Figure 266).
Put the interlock pin in the hole drilled in the side of the 1-2 shift shaft (Figure 266).

Put the 1-2 shift sleeve in the housing. Make sure the bore of the sleeve is aligned with the bore in the housing. Make sure the threaded hole in the sleeve is toward the rear of the housing (Figure 266).
Push the shift shaft through the 1-2 shift sleeve ( Figure 266).

figure.caption: Figure 266. Put 1-2 Shift Shaft in Middle Bore, Put Interlock Pin in Hole, and Put 1-2 Shift Sleeve in Housing

step1.para: Put the 1-2 shift fork in the housing. Make sure bend on the fork is installed toward the middle set of shift rail bores in the top cover housing. Make sure the bore of the fork is aligned with the bore in the housing ( Figure 267).
Push the shift shaft through the 1-2 fork until the holes in the fork and the sleeve are aligned with the holes in the shaft (Figure 267).

figure.caption: Figure 267. Push Shift Shaft Through 1-2 Fork

caution.para: After the set screws with the Loctite sealant are tightened to the specified torque, do not loosen or tighten. If loosened or tightened, the set screws must be removed, cleaned and new sealant applied or the bolts may loosen during operation.

step1.para: Install the set screw with the Loctite sealant that fastens the fork and the sleeve in position on the shaft. Tighten the set screw to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).
Install the lock wire in the holes in the set screws.
Put the interlock ball in the bottom of the top bore of the first set of bores in the rear of the housing ( Figure 268).

figure.caption: Figure 268. Put Interlock Ball in Bottom of Top Bore

step1.para: Make sure the low-reverse sleeve and the 1-2 sleeve are in the NEUTRAL position. The slots in the sleeve must be aligned ( Figure 269).

figure.caption: Figure 269. Make Sure Sleeves are in Neutral Position

step1.para: If removed, install the plunger assembly in the 3-4 shift sleeve. Put the sleeve in a vise with brass jaws. Install the spring (if used) and the plunger in the sleeve. Install the snap ring that holds the assembly in the fork ( Figure 270).

note.para: For R-ratio transmissions, the bill of material refers to the 3-4 shift fork as the OD (Overdrive) shift fork and the 3-shift sleeve as the OD shift Sleeve.
The 3-4 shift shaft has a slot on one side.
Move the 1-2 shift shaft assembly so that the interlock ball is completely installed in the bore. Move the 1-2 shaft assembly so that the 3-4 shaft can be installed.

step1.para: Put 3-4 shift shaft in the top bore of the housing. Make sure interlock slot on the end of the rail is toward the rear of the housing. Makes sure the detent grooves in the shaft are aligned with the detent ball holes in the housing ( Figure 271).

figure.caption: Figure 271. Put 3-4 Shift Shaft in Top Bore of Housing

step1.para: Put the 3-4 shift sleeve in the housing. Make sure the bore of the fork and sleeve assembly is aligned with the bore in the housing. Make sure the slot pin in the 3-4 sleeve is aligned with the hole in the 1-2 sleeve ( Figure 272).

figure.caption: Figure 272. Put 3-4 Shift Sleeve in Housing

step1.para: Push shift shaft through 3-4 shift sleeve.

Put the 3-4 shift fork in the housing. Make sure the bend on the fork is installed toward the last set of bores in the housing. Make sure the bore of the fork is aligned with the bore in the housing (Figure 271).
Push the shift shaft through the 3-4 fork until the holes in the fork and the sleeve are aligned with the holes in the shaft.

caution.para: After the set screws with the Loctite sealant are tightened to the specified torque, do not loosen or tighten. If loosened or tightened, the set screws must be removed, cleaned and new sealant applied or the bolts may loosen during operation.

step1.para: Install the set screws with the Loctite sealant that fastens the 3-4 fork and the sleeve to the rail. Tighten the set screw to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs).
Install the lock wire in the bolts, the sleeve and the fork.
If removed, install the large oil scoop on the housing. Install and tighten the bolts with the Loctite sealant to 14 to 18 Nm (10 to 13 ft-lbs.) (Figure 273).
If removed, install the small scoop on the housing. Install and tighten the bolts with the Loctite sealant to 14 to 18 Nm (10 to 13 ft-lbs) (Figure 273).
